required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Influence of Extracorporeal Circulation on the Development of OSA (Obstructive Sleep Apnea)
clinical_study.official_title: Influence of Extracorporeal Circulation on the Development of OSA (Obstructive Sleep Apnea)

brief_summary.textblock:
- 1. Coronary artery bypass grafting (CABG) could be performed with or without extracorporeal circulation (ECC).
- 2. OSA (Obstructive Sleep Apnea) could be influenced by in intravenous perfusion.
- 3. ECC could influence the amount of intravenous perfusion administered to the patient.
The aim of this study was to examine the influence of ECC on the development of OSA.

detailed_description.textblock:
- 1. Coronary artery bypass grafting (CABG) could be performed with or without extracorporeal circulation (ECC).
- 2. OSA (Obstructive Sleep Apnea) could be influenced by in intravenous perfusion.
- 3. ECC could influence the amount of intravenous perfusion administered to the patient.
The aim of this study was to examine the influence of ECC on the development of OSA. The AHI (Apnea Hypopnea Index) will be used to assess this potential influence.

primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline AHI (Apnea Hypopnea Index, which is the average amount of apnea and hypopnea per four of sleep) at the 3rd postoperative day. The AHI is derived from the polysomnography which will be performed to all of the patients the day before surgery and the 3rd postoperative day.

arm_group.description: Group of patients for whom CABG was performed under ECC. A polysomnography will be performed to all of these patients the day before surgery and the third postoperative day.
Group of patients for whom CABG was performed without ECC. A polysomnography will be performed to all of these patients the day before surgery and the third postoperative day.

intervention.description: A polysomnography will be performed for all of the patients the day before surgery (value of reference), and on the second postoperative day (in order to examine the influence of ECC on the development of OSA).

study_pop.textblock: All of the patients scheduled for an elective CABG at the Clinique Saint-Luc of Bouge (Namur, Belgium).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All of the patients scheduled for an elective CABG
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient's refusal

responsible_party.investigator_full_name: Eric DEFLANDRE, MD, PhD, FCCP, FAHA
